pvpMatrix.title: PVP Matrix

intro: Bienvenue sur Pokebattler.com ! Le plus sophistiqué et le meilleur simulateur d'arènes et de raid jamais inventé sur Pokemon GO. Vous voulez savoir ce qu'il en est de ce Ronflex ? Essayez chacun de vos pokémons pour voir comment il se comportent en combat d'arène. Un rapport complet du combat, attaque après attaque, est disponible.
outro: Restez attentif aux prochaines mises à jour comme la possibilité de sauvegarder ses pokémon et plus encore.

intro.title: Set up a battle
intro.text: The Pokebattler battle simulator is highly accurate and allows you to customize your combat options in many ways. Options include:

outro.title: Battle!
outro.text: Full combat results will be shown. Feel free to X out and try out other combinations.

steps[0].label: Type in the search bar
steps[0].description: Choose the attackers and defenders you wish to battle

steps[1].label: Basic mode
steps[1].description: Enter the CP, don't worry about your hidden stats, we will figure it out for you as best we can.

steps[2].label: Advanced mode
steps[2].description: Enter the exact level and hidden stats of your pokemon for the most accurate simulation

steps[3].label: Choose your moves
steps[3].description: Try out all the combinations of quick and charge moves

steps[4].label: Choose your strategies
steps[4].description: Customize the way the pokemon attack and defend. See the definitions section below.

intro.title: Customize your rankings
intro.text: Pokebattler rankings are the most advanced around! No other site lets you change your settings and compare every pokemon under different constraints. Customization options include:

outro.title: Investigate!
outro.text: The best move combinations for each pokemon are shown. Clicking on a pokemon will give detailed information about all the move combinations.

steps[0].label: Attacker/Defender
steps[0].description: Choose whether you are attacking or defending. Attacker shows the results vs. all possible defenders. Defender shows the results vs. the best 6 possible attackers

steps[1].label: Sort
steps[1].description: Choose the type of ranking you want (see below)

steps[2].label: Level
steps[2].description: Choose the level of the attacker and defender pokemon

steps[3].label: Single/Group
steps[3].description: Choose whether to see every move combination or only show the best per pokemon

intro.title: Customize Pokemon
intro.text: The Pokedex page is a great place to analyze Pokemon in depth. Customization options include:

outro.title: Analyze
outro.text: Lookup any pokemon you are interested in. Find out what there best movesets are on both attack and defense. Discover which pokemon you should avoid and how to beat this pokemon on attack.

steps[0].label: Sort
steps[0].description: Choose the type of ranking you want (see below)

steps[1].label: Level
steps[1].description: Choose the level of the attacker and defender pokemon

articles.title: Articles
articles.text: The articles section contains all the best research posts from a select set of curated authors as well as some articles related to current events and discussion items. If you would like your articles hosted here,

intro.text: Dodge strategies are a way to fine tune the attack strategy algorithm to give more realistic results. They are used to account for human error, bugs and other things.

options[0].label: Overall
options[0].description: A rating that gives an overall score for a particular pokemon. The rating is gives 50% weighting to power, 30% weighting to time to win and 20% to potions

options[1].label: Power
options[1].description: A percent that represents how many times a pokemon would kill another. 250% means it would kill it 2 times and then die half way through the 3rd attempt. 75% means it died after only doing 75% of the targets health.

options[2].label: Time to Win
options[2].description: Shows the amount of time it would take for the Pokemon to win. 2 seconds is added for each time the pokemon feinted.

options[3].label: Win %
options[3].description: Ranks by percentage chance to win

options[5].label: Potions
options[5].description: Ranks by number of basic potions it would take to heal plus 5 for each time the pokemon feinted and would need a revive.
